title: Does anyone else want the old champions back?
body:
Does anyone else want the old champions back?
some Reworks are Needed and are okay and fun but 
Others not so much they just took what we liked from the champs and just throw it in the trash.
You cant really play them the same way and if its one of your mains you just get screwed over

replies.body: I miss the old Quinn x)

Same...

{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
Second this. I miss being a bird

Actually 70% of the smaller 'class' type reworks have been terrible, and made much bigger balance problems than the old champ ever was.

Most of them like Veigar, Kog, Malz, Ryze etc etc. have either been reworked again, or almost completely reverted within months of being reworked.
And several others like Aatrox and LeBlanc are about to be thrown back into the 
machine as well.

So either Riot is putting 0% effort and thought into the reworks, or the universe is trying to tell us not to rework champs for no reason.


On a personal note, I miss old Taric, I absolutely love new Taric, and I wouldn't trade him for the world. but I do miss the playstyle of old Taric.
Me and him were inseparable in ranked. We had each others backs _(in the least gayest way of course)_.

Also 2 of my 3 mains; Azir and Sol have had reworks announced..... oh Joy....

Admittedly Sol could do with a tweak here and there so hes more friendly to play for noobies >_<
But a complete overhaul would be a waste of what he is now :(

I dont know, tbh I feel like if you're new to the game, you play Garen or Yi.
and when you're more experienced, you play Sol or Kalista.

That way, theres a champ for everyone.

If all champions have to be accessible to new players, then we just get boring easy champs. and seeming no one stays new forever, it'd be a waste if all champs were beginner level.

Sol has some very harsh weaknesses its true, but I've managed to get a 70% win rate on him in ranked, and I'm just some random mid silver player, so if I can do it, I don't see any reason why others cant make him work as well.

Yea a complete overhaul would ruin him :/
The thing is, the '_problem_' with him, is his stars, but thats the 1 thing you absolutely cant take away from him. So its a very sucky situation.
Tbh I just hope they forget the whole thing. :P

The only thing I can see them doing to make him "noob" friendly is giving him more than just 3 balls, or making the balls spin at a faster rate when expanded. Or they could also just allow him to instantly recast his Q to remove the hard counter-picks that he has like yasuo/zed/ekko/etc. He is somewhat a decent champion if you learn him but also in the same breath has such huge weaknesses when it comes to the meta of mobile champs in the mid-lane, if any champ gets on to him he is in a bit of a pickle w/o ult or sums.
Aurelion sol's rework would be interesting to say the least

I think all you need to do is put some solid time and effort in to learning Aurelion Sol, He does feel extremely weak in lane but that's simply not true, I've heard he has the second highest firstblood rate, (behind Talon) due to his apparent strong level 1/2, Learn placement of balls and roam.  His roams are extremely strong :P Might need to tweak your runepages and masteries a tad to make The Sol work. 

Watch the video where huhi states that Aurelion Sol is his pocket pick! You might learn some! xD
RIP old graves
old graves and ap yi, the two i miss most :(

You obviously never got 1 shot by a fed lb pressing Q R. in .5 a second lol.. It's nearly as bad as a fed syndra pressing Q R nowadays.

She was mobile and did insane burst with no mechanics involved.

I've never understood the reworks.
Tweaking is one thing, but if you want to change them completely (such as Galio), just make it a new champ, don't remove the old one.

It's just a laziness thing, recycling code rather than making new champs.

[edit] Oh, and any reworked champ should give a refund option on champ and skin purchase. I have skins for champs that got reworked and I never want to play again. Shit in the bowl.

Some champions fall out of meta and need a rework though. 

Or they were very niche picks which were EXTREMELY situational.. Fiora for example :p 
Old Darius was snowbally and unstoppable when he got firstblood, Which would happen all the time in low elo. Old Darius could apply  4 stacks in less than 2 seconds. dealing insane damage even when inside his spin & applying stacks..
Let us not forget {{champion:83}} playing him support summon a ghoul to block a cait ult was so good

New Yorick is op :D 

Been seeing him a lot recently in ranked (Diamond 5/4) many bizarre builds going for him at the moment.
even a game mode that lets you play the old champs

They're already talked about that, but it would require so much work to do for not that much payoff int he grand scheme of things. I'd love a chance to relive the glory days of AP Yi, or give old Karma a go again, but just like a scuttlebug Jamboree, it's not going to happen.
Ap yi was so troll lol

I'm a {{champion:74}} main.

I was a little nervous about his most recent change (halving his base damage and doubling his AP scaling) because I enjoyed playing the split-push tank build of Zz'Rot and Banner of Command. Since his base damage was enough to scare off most people while he pushed like a monster.

But once his rework came out, I fell in love with the champ all over again. It opened up so many new opportunities for me and allowed me to try new things that previously were not as viable.

When a champ's kit is overloaded or doesn't allow for counterplay, there must be some change that Riot implements. Such as Darius' Q.

On the flipside, Urgot and Galio (as examples) were very uncommon champs and both had below average winrates for most patches. Their kits were outdated and clunky. The majority of players considered them boring to play or they were just too far outside the meta to be considered decent picks.

Champs are updated in order to make them more in-tune with the current meta and the directions in which the game has been going. They may be inconvenient for the minority of players, but they are convenient for the majority of players.
i miss the old taric and the old gangplank let along sword of the occult i feel Zilean needs a touch up tho he is not changed in so long
I saw someone straight up Q a vayne as Gangplank the other day for 90% of her hp due to Duskblade {{item:3147}}  It brought back memories of the critplank haha xD

Zilean needs a good bug fixing first!!!
So many times have i tried to grant someone a level, and it has used E instead, sending them flying off away from me ;_;
I want poppies old ult back...

Evelynn OTP here... hoping they don't ruin her with the rework.

The fact Galio is *nothing* like his pre-rework worries me.

i mained both shen and galio before rework both champs are so different for me and just not worth it.
Sure they have there place but its not the same for me
